links.title: Fed's Brainard to Take Questions on Inflation, Job Market, Interest Rates
links.description: Federal Reserve governor Lael Brainard is set to take questions Tuesday on the U.S. economic outlook and its implications for the labor market, inflation and central-bank policies. Ms. Brainard, who is awaiting Senate confirmation to serve as the Fed's vice chairwoman, is scheduled to speak in a 35-minute interview beginning at 12:10 p.m.

links.title: NYPD investigating possible explosion in Brooklyn subway station during morning rush hour
links.description: The NYPD is investigating a possible explosion in the subway in Brooklyn Tuesday morning, police said. The incident broke out around 8:30 a.m. at the 36th Street station in Sunset Park. Gruesome photos have emerged on social media at the station but it was still unclear what unfolded with unconfirmed reports of an explosion or a mass shooting.

links.title: Why Apple Stock Buybacks -and Its Dividend - Could Get a Big Boost
links.description: Apple's quarterly earnings reports frequently hog the spotlight on days when they drop. The world's largest publicly listed company has the ability to drag the rest of the stock market - and indexes like the S&P 500 - around with it. When the tech giant reports results later this month, investors will be eyeing revenue and profit, as usual.

links.title: Shanghai Factory Closures Mount as Covid-19 Lockdowns Hit Supply Chains
links.description: More factories in and around Shanghai, including two run by an Apple Inc. supplier, are halting production because of extended Covid-19 lockdowns in the region, adding to pressure on the global supply chain. Analysts said Shanghai-area manufacturers were having more trouble getting parts delivered because China's restrictions on movement are making it difficult for trucks to enter the region.

links.title: Apple Supplier Pegatron Halts Operations in China, Reports Say
links.description: Pegatron Corp, a Taiwanese iPhone supplier for Apple, said on Tuesday it will temporarily cease operations at its Shanghai and Kushan factories in China as Beijing tries to contain the spread of Covid-19 cases, according to media reports.
